intro: Calcaratolobelia gibbosa, commonly known as the mountain marsh bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands and marshes of southeastern Australia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland wetland habitats. Calcaratolobelia gibbosa plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
